item.title: Yet another huge Flytip at top of Stembridge road, 23rd July
item.description:
Yet another huge Flytip at top of Stembridge road plus I had to clear the street yet again. All rubbish collected from stembridge road in green bag. The road needs cleaning regularly but it is never done by the council. I have to do this once a week which really isn’t on. Please remove asap

item.title: The bus lane at the bottom of South End Green near The Royal Free, 23rd July
item.description:

item.title: More rubbish dumped by Priory's bins on corner of Lancaster & Webbet St, 23rd July
item.description:
Second incident in a week of someone leaving general rubbish (lamps and suitcases) by the bins on the corner of Webber and Lancaster St. Partly exacerbated by one of the lids on the recyling bin missing so it invites rubbish. Also someone has filled the food waste bin with non-food waste.

item.title: Badly positioned and now newly damaged New silver bollards in High St Penge, jct Penge Lane, fronting the Crooked Billet PH., 23rd July
item.description:
New silver bollards in High St Penge, jct Penge Lane, fronting the Crooked Billet PH. Extensive bus or other vehicle bollard impact damage was reported last year and took over 9 months to get replaced. I pointed out that the bollards were originally badly positioned and requested that any replacements should be done 'further in' towards the clock feature to allow buses to manoeuvre in the narrow carriageway width. The bollards have been at long last replaced about 2 weeks ago (circa 10/7/25) but totally ignoring my repositioning request! Already, as I predicted, a board has been hit, tilted and judging by the red paint residue, impacted by a bus turning in this awkward space. Before any further damage is done, please return and relocate the brand new bollards say, 1m further in towards the street clock. It has been said that madness is doing the same thing repeatedly and expecting a different result! This is just wasting precious council / taxpayer money.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penge Lane, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Streetlight Out on Sussex Street - Safety Concern, 23rd July
item.description:
Dear I hope you are well. I am a resident of Sussex Street (SW1V 4RG), and I'm writing to report that one of the streetlights on our road has not been working. As a result, the street becomes extremely dark at night, which raises serious safety concerns for residents and passersby. Given that we contribute through our council tax, I kindly ask if this issue could be addressed at your earliest convenience. A functioning streetlight is essential for ensuring safety and peace of mind in the neighbourhood. Thank you in advance for your support. Please let me know if you need any further details. Best regards, R Gomes Sussex street, SW1V 4RG

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sussex Street, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass, weed cutting, 23rd July
item.description:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to follow up on a grass cutting request I reported on 14th July. Although a contractor did attend and cut part of the area, the work remains incomplete — a significant section has still not been attended to and is now noticeably overgrown. ( this same situation is happening second year in the row) The uncut area is not only unsightly but also poses safety concerns and is contributing to a build-up of litter. The long grass and weeds makes it difficult to maintain cleanliness and creates an uninviting and potentially hazardous environment. I would appreciate it if this could be reviewed and the remaining section added to the schedule as soon as possible. Thank you in advance for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response. Yours faithfully, residents

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Millfields Cottages, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree Growth Blocking The Footpath, 23rd July
item.description:
A tree at the Parkside Avenue end of the footpath between Southborough Road and Parkview Avenue needs pruning. Growth from ground level is now almost blocking the footpath, a major deterrent to use after rain. This may have been previously reported but the previous location was rather different. The subject of this report is clearly visible from Parkside Avenue, looking east along the pathway towards Southborough Road and Park Hill.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkside Avenue, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet
